misconceptions.task: Correct pattern (1 star to N stars)
misconceptions.name: Implemented a different triangle problem instead of the required star pattern
misconceptions.description: The student wrote a program to compute the area of a triangle given three coordinate points using Heron's formula, instead of printing a right triangle of asterisks with N rows as specified.
misconceptions.student_belief: I believe the task is to read three points of a triangle and compute its area.
misconceptions.correct_understanding: The task is to read a single integer N from the user and print N lines of asterisks forming a right triangle: the first line has 1 '*', the second line has 2 '*', and so on up to N '*'.
symptoms: Program prompts for three coordinate points instead of a single height N.
No loops that iterate from 1 to N to print rows.
No logic that prints a varying number of asterisks per line.
Output is a numeric area value, not a star pattern.
misconceptions.root_cause: Misinterpretation of the problem requirements, possibly confusing this question with a different triangle-related exercise (e.g., computing area with Heron's formula).
misconceptions.remediation_hint: Re-read the question carefully and focus on the required input and output shape. Start by writing code that: (1) reads an integer N, (2) uses an outer loop to go from 1 to N, and (3) uses an inner loop (or string repetition) to print that many '*' characters on each line.
misconceptions.confidence_rationale: The entire program structure addresses a completely different problem (triangle area from coordinates) and contains no elements related to printing a star pattern.

evidence.note: All input and output are dedicated to reading 3 points and computing the triangle area, with no handling of a height N or star pattern.

misconceptions.name: Complete misunderstanding of the assignment requirements
misconceptions.description: The student implemented a program to calculate the area of a triangle given three points (using Heron's formula and a distance function), which is completely unrelated to the assigned task of printing a right triangle pattern of asterisks based on an input height N.
misconceptions.student_belief: The student seems to believe the assignment was to calculate the area of a triangle based on three coordinate points, ignoring the prompt's explicit instruction to read a height N and print an asterisk pattern.
misconceptions.correct_understanding: The correct program should involve reading a single integer N (the height) and using nested loops to print N rows, with the i-th row containing i asterisks.
symptoms: Code implements a completely different problem (Heron's formula/distance calculation)
Input prompts ask for three coordinate points, not a single height N
No loops or printing of asterisks whatsoever
misconceptions.root_cause: Misinterpretation or complete neglect of the problem statement and requirements.
misconceptions.remediation_hint: Carefully read all prompt requirements. This assignment asks for a pattern printing program using nested loops, not a geometric area calculation.
misconceptions.confidence_rationale: The submitted code addresses a different problem entirely (calculating triangle area from coordinates) and contains none of the required elements for the assigned task (reading height N, loops, printing asterisks).

evidence.note: The class name suggests the student is working on a different problem.
The input prompts ask for coordinates instead of the required height N.

misconceptions.name: Misunderstanding Problem Requirements
misconceptions.description: The student completely misunderstood the assignment. Instead of reading a single integer N for triangle height and printing an asterisk pattern, the student wrote a program that reads three coordinate points and calculates triangle area using Heron's formula.
misconceptions.student_belief: The student appears to believe the task is to calculate the area of a triangle given three coordinate points using Heron's formula.
misconceptions.correct_understanding: The task requires reading a single integer N from the user and printing a right triangle pattern made of asterisks, where row i contains i asterisks (1 to N).
symptoms: Program requests three coordinate points instead of a single height value
Program calculates geometric area instead of printing a visual pattern
No asterisk pattern output
No loop structure for printing rows
Output is a numerical calculation, not a triangle shape
misconceptions.root_cause: The student either read the wrong problem, confused this assignment with a different triangle problem, or failed to carefully read the problem statement and sample output.
misconceptions.remediation_hint: Re-read the problem statement carefully. Note that the task asks for a RIGHT TRIANGLE PATTERN made of asterisks with N rows, not an area calculation. Study the sample run showing the asterisk output format.
misconceptions.confidence_rationale: Extremely high confidence. The submitted code solves a completely different problem (triangle area calculation using coordinates and Heron's formula) compared to the required task (printing an asterisk triangle pattern). There is no overlap in functionality between what was asked and what was submitted.

evidence.note: Program asks for three coordinate points instead of reading a single height integer N as required.

misconceptions.task: Correct pattern (1 star to N stars)
misconceptions.name: Misinterpreting the problem requirements (geometry vs star pattern)
misconceptions.description: The student implemented a program to compute the area of a triangle from three coordinate points using Heron’s formula instead of printing a right triangle pattern of asterisks based on a single input height N.
misconceptions.student_belief: I should write a program that reads three points of a triangle and computes its area, which is what the assignment is asking for.
misconceptions.correct_understanding: For this question, the program should read a single integer N (the height) and then use loops to print N lines of '*' characters, with line i containing i stars, forming a right triangle pattern. It does not involve geometric coordinates or area calculations.
symptoms: Program prompts for three points of a triangle instead of a single integer height.
Code computes distances between points and uses Heron’s formula.
No loops or logic related to printing rows of '*' characters.
Output is a numeric area value, not a text-based triangle pattern.
misconceptions.root_cause: Misreading or misinterpreting the assignment instructions, possibly confusing this problem with a different one involving triangle area or reusing code from another exercise.
misconceptions.remediation_hint: Re-read the problem statement and restate it in your own words before coding. Identify exactly what inputs are required (here: one integer N) and what the output should look like (a right triangle made of '*', using loops). Then design your loops around printing text patterns rather than performing unrelated geometric calculations.
related_concepts: Mapping problem requirements to input/output behavior
Console text output and pattern printing
